name: St. Athanasius the Athonite

locations.description: Founder of the Great Lavra on Mount Athos

summary: Athanasius the Athonite was a Byzantine monk who founded the Great Lavra monastery on Mount Athos, the first and largest of the Athonite monasteries. He established the cenobitic (communal) form of monasticism on Mount Athos, which became the dominant form. He was a spiritual father to many monks and helped organize the monastic community on the Holy Mountain. Mount Athos became one of the most important centers of Orthodox monasticism, a status it maintains to this day.
